column4: Hey all.  I have a Dell Inspiron 1420 with a few media keys on it.  I've successfully and correctly binded them to the keyboard.  In Amarok, I've modified both the shortcuts and global shortcuts to use the media keys, but no luck.  Any help?
go to scripts there is one that has to do with media keys and gnome. it will make them work
Tools > Script MAnager > Get more scripts
Oh, in Amarok?  Alright, thanks a lot.
np. it took me a while, but my gateway's media keys work perfect for me now. it should be on by default in gnome...
Uh oh, it just crashed on me.  I got the KNotify.  Shouldn't be anything bad, but I'm wondering why it crashed after I installed that.
i get that occasionally. i don't think it has to do with the script tho, just that it's a kde app running on gnome
Got it, works perfectly now.  Thanks a bunch.
no problem. i love that script. helps with **all** media keys, so nice.
xfe is cool, and really lightweight. not the best looking, but cool. look it up. ot's available in the repositories.
not that i know of. it's pretty hard to replace nautilus. it controls the desktiop and icons too. neither do if you just install them. google could help make it permanent.
Is there a way I could make it default, at least?
not that i know of. i tried to set pcman fm as default once, but it didn't work. like i said, google could help. someone had to do it at least once.
Alright, thanks.  Just wanted to check with you first since it's a bit more of an intimate troubleshoot. =P
yeah, I have no idea =P so no bad advice
